DataElement.preferredName: Vanillyl Mandelic Acid Measurement Performed Laboratory Procedure Integer::1 Decimal Place of Creatinine Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory microgram unit per milligram of creatinine value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of vanillylmandelic acid measurement in a specimen.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 1 Decimal Place Microgram Unit per Milligram of Creatinine Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram._An arbitrary unit of substance concentration expressed in unit(s) per milligram of creatinine._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::1 Decimal Place Microgram Unit per Milligram of Creatinine Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one one thousandth of a milligram.:An arbitrary unit of substance concentration expressed in unit(s) per milligram of creatinine.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.
An arbitrary unit of substance concentration expressed in unit(s) per milligram of creatinine.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
